p: Children and the elderly have a lower threshold for leakage than adults ( Gamble et al., 2000). Primary infections in children are often asymptomatic or may cause a relatively benign nonspecific febrile illness ( Endy et al., 2002). Studies have shown that children have greater risk for vascular leakage and development of DSS compared with adults ( Anders et al., 2011, Trung et al., 2012).
